Module contents¶

jaxparrow.tools.compute_coriolis_factor(lat: int | ndarray | MaskedArray) → ndarray | MaskedArray¶

Computes the Coriolis factor from latitudes

Parameters:

lat (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – latitude

Returns:

Coriolis factor

Return type:

Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]

jaxparrow.tools.compute_cyclogeostrophic_diff_jax(u_geos: ndarray, v_geos: ndarray, u_cyclo: ndarray | Array, v_cyclo: ndarray | Array, dx_u: ndarray, dx_v: ndarray, dy_u: ndarray, dy_v: ndarray, coriolis_factor_u: ndarray, coriolis_factor_v: ndarray) → Array¶

Computes the cyclogeostrophic imbalance

Parameters:

  • u_geos (np.ndarray) – U geostrophic velocity value

  • v_geos (np.ndarray) – V geostrophic velocity value

  • u_cyclo (Union[np.ndarray, jax.Array]) – U cyclogeostrophic velocity value

  • v_cyclo (Union[np.ndarray, jax.Array]) – V cyclogeostrophic velocity value

  • dx_u (np.ndarray) – U spatial step along x

  • dx_v (np.ndarray) – V spatial step along x

  • dy_u (np.ndarray) – U spatial step along y

  • dy_v (np.ndarray) – V spatial step along y

  • coriolis_factor_u (np.ndarray) – U Coriolis factor

  • coriolis_factor_v (np.ndarray) – V Coriolis factor

Returns:

the loss

Return type:

jax.Array

jaxparrow.tools.compute_spatial_step(lat: ndarray | MaskedArray, lon: ndarray | MaskedArray, bounds: Tuple[float, float] = (100.0, 10000.0), fill_value: float = 1000000000000.0) → Tuple[ndarray, ndarray]¶

Computes dx and dy spatial steps of a grid defined by lat, lon. It makes use of the distance-on-a-sphere formula with Taylor expansion approximations of cos and arccos functions to avoid truncation issues.

Parameters:

  • lat (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – latitude

  • lon (Union[np.ndarray, np.ma.MaskedArray]) – longitude

  • bounds (Tuple[float, float], optional) – range of acceptable values, defaults to (1e2, 1e4). Out of this range, set to fill_value

  • fill_value (float, optional) – fill value, defaults to 1e12

Returns:

dx and dy spatial steps

Return type:

Tuple[np.ndarray, np.ndarray]

jaxparrow
